awd_titl_txt: Active and Passive Controls of Complex Structures With      Uncertainties Under Wind Loads
awd_abstract_narration: A hybrid (combining passive with active)                                        control system will be developed that                                           incorporates a refined stochastic finite                                        element method for the optimal control of                                       buildings, bridges and other complex shell                                      structures such as domes, towers, tanks and                                     chimneys, with uncertain structural                                             parameters and which can be exposed to random                                   dynamic wind loads.  The structural                                             uncertainties are assumed as random in space.                                   The wind loads are assumed as random in both                                    time space.  This development may also be                                       applied to earthquake loads.  The goal is to                                    develop a hybrid control system that                                            significantly improves the reliability and                                      safety of complex structures subjected to                                       extreme random loads produced by certain                                        natural hazards.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
